The claim is debunked by the expert: s verdict, stating that no government or law enforcement agency in the U.K. sent out any text messages informing recipients of fines for leaving the house during the coronavirus lockdown.
The expert: s verdict emphasizes that the messages in question are part of a scam to steal personal information. This indicates that the authenticity of the claim is highly questionable.
The West Mercia Police: as mentioned in the expert's verdict, have issued a warning about fraud and scams during the COVID-19 pandemic, advising recipients not to respond to such text messages by calling phone numbers or clicking on links they contain. This further supports the conclusion that the claim is not authentic.
